text:
e="preserve">Arkady Ter-Tadevosyan (; also known by the troops under his command as Komandos (); May 22, 1939 in Tbilisi, Georgian SSR).
He was a military leader of the Armenian forces during the Nagorno-Karabakh War. He is best known as the commander of the operation to capture the town of Shushi in May 1992.
He has the rank of major general in the Armenian Army. He attended a military academy in Saint Petersburg and served in the Soviet Army.
